intro: Tragacantha hendersonii, commonly known as Henderson's tragacanth, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant produces a unique gum, similar to tragacanth, which has been historically used in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand long periods of drought. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
